data.title: The City of Darlington, South Carolina
data.meta_description: City Services offered by the City of Darlington include Fire, Police, Mayor, Council, Planning, Street & Sanitation, Recreation, Water, Sewer, and more.
data.meta_site_name: The City of Darlington, South Carolina
data.text:
City Services

Administration

Discover the City of Darlington Administration members. The City of Darlington is open for business Mon-Fri 8:30 am-5 pm.

Read more

Boards & Commissions

Members help maintain historic value and beautification of our city.

Read more

City of Darlington Forms

Directory of City of Darlington forms for various departments and services

Read more

City of Darlington Jobs

CURRENT JOB OFFERINGS: City Manager, Water & Sewer Maintenance Technician Senior, Public Works Clerical & Utility, City Firefighter II & Police Department Patrol Officers

Read more

Code of Ordinances

Ordinance No. 2019-12, adopted June 20, 2019.

Read more

Codes Enforcement

Codes Enforcement handles zoning and commercial inspections, restoration approval of historical homes, commercial codes and more.

Read more

Finance

City Administration oversees budget, with final approval from City Council.

Read more

Fire Department

Established in 1880, the Darlington Fire Department serves the City of Darlington 24-7 with a combination of full time and paid on-call employees.

Read more

In the News

For Residents and Visitors alike, stay informed with the latest City of Darlington news, closures, community happenings, notices, and announcements here!

Read more

Mayor & Council

The City of Darlington is divided into three precincts with its own council member and three at-large council members. Mr. Curtis Boyd serves as Mayor.

Read more

Municipal Court

The City of Darlington Municipal Court is located in Darlington City Hall at 400 Pearl Street. The City of Darlington Municipal Judge is Robert Stucks. Assoc. Justice Taft Guiles.

Read more

Planning & Development

Supporting the business community, providing resources and encouraging new development.

Read more

Police Department

The Darlington Police Department may be found in City Hall at 400 Pearl Street.

Read more

Recreation

The City of Darlington has a host of recreation opportunities for its citizens and visitors.

Read more

Requests for Proposals & Bids

OPEN Bids: COD is accepting sealed offers to Purchase a Parcel of land. BID DUE: May 31, 2024 @ 12 PM.

Read more

Street & Sanitation

Yard debris pickup, recycling containers and residential garbage issues or concerns.

Read more

Water & Sewer

The City of Darlington Water & Sewer department can be found at 400 Pearl Street.

Read more

OFFICES CLOSED: Due to the potential impacts of Tropical Storm Debby, the City of Darlington's Administrative Offices will be closed on Thursday, August 8, 2024. All emergency personnel will continue to report. For all emergencies, dial 911.

TROPICAL STORM DEBBY UPDATES: To view up-to-date information on how Tropical Storm Debby is impacting the City of Darlington, please visit www.cityofdarlington.com/hurricane-debby-storm center.
